Package aom.scripting.xs.tr

Class Triggers

Object
Triggers
public abstract class Triggers
extends Object
This class provides a collection of Trigger commands that don't fit in any of the subcategories.
Author:
Mythic_Freak - mythic.freak[a]gmail.com

  • Field Details

    • cNumberPlayers

      public final int cNumberPlayers
      Total number of players, mother nature included.

    • cOriginVector

      public final vector cOriginVector
      The vector indicating the bottom of the map, i.e. (0, 0, 0).

    • cInvalidVector

      public final vector cInvalidVector
      The invalid vector (-1,-1,-1).

      public bool trArmyDispatch​(string SrcArmy, string ProtoName, int Count, float x, float y, float z, int Heading, bool Clear)
      Creates the units in the army specified. Only works for human players online. Returns true if successful.

    • trCheckGPActive

      public bool trCheckGPActive​(string godPower, int playerID)
      Returns whether that GP type, for that player, is currently in effect.

      public int trCountUnitsInArea​(int centerUnitID, int matchPlayer, int matchType, float range)
      Returns the number of units in an area that match the params.

    • trDelayedRuleActivation

      public void trDelayedRuleActivation​(string rulename)
      Adds a rule to the runtime to be activated on the next update. This causes the rule to be delayed by a small fraction of time, but often enough to properly complete commands that might take a little while.
      See Also:
      xsEnableRule(string)

    • trEcho

      public void trEcho​(string echoString)
      Prints the given string to the RTS3banglog.txt file in the AoM folder.

    • trEchoStatValue

      public void trEchoStatValue​(int playerID, int statID)
      Fetch a stat value from the KB and echo to chat.

    • trEndGame

      public void trEndGame()
      Signal that the game has ended

    • trEventFire

      public void trEventFire​(int eventID)
      Cause an event to occur.

      Under the hood, an eventID is generated for this event. This event is registered in the default event handler using trEventSetHandler(myEventID, "eventHandler");. Next, this piece of code is appended at the end of the eventHandler function: 

      case myEventID:
{
   xsEnableRule("_My Trigger");
   trEcho("Trigger enabling rule My Trigger");
   break;
}

    • trEventSetHandler

      public void trEventSetHandler​(int eventID, string handlerFunction)
      Sets a handler function f(int status) for an eventID. Every time this event is fired, the given hander function will automatically be called with the eventID as its status.

    • trForbidProtounit

      public void trForbidProtounit​(int playerID, string protoname)
      Adds protounit to the forbidden list.

    • trModifyProtounit

      public void trModifyProtounit​(string protoUnit, int playerID, int field, float delta)
      Modifies protounit data for this scenario only.
      Parameters:
      protoUnit - The name of the protounit to modify.
      playerID - The player for which the modifications should occur.
      field - TriggerParamType.PUFIELD
      delta - The (relative) amount to change.
      Since:
      AoT

    • trSetDisableGPBlocking

      public void trSetDisableGPBlocking​(bool b)
      Enable or Disable GP blocking (e.g. by Isis monuments).
      Since:
      AoT

    • trSetFogAndBlackmap

      public void trSetFogAndBlackmap​(bool fog, bool blackmap)
      Turn fog and black map on/off. Similar to the console commands, this just disables the rendering of fog and blackmap. Any area that was previously unscouted will still act as if it was unscouted. To have this scouted effect, use trRevealEntireMap() instead.
      See Also:
      fog(), blackmap()

    • trSetLighting

      public void trSetLighting​(string setName, float fadeTime)
      Fades to the specified lighting set over a given fadeTime.

    • trSetPauseInObjectiveWindow

      public void trSetPauseInObjectiveWindow()
      Automatically pauses the game if the Objectives windows opens.
      Single Player Only
      [@single ]

    • trSetPauseOnAgeUpgrade

      public void trSetPauseOnAgeUpgrade()
      Automatically pauses the game if the Age Advancement windows opens.
      Single Player Only
      [@single ]

    • trSetRelicType

      public void trSetRelicType​(int techID)
      Changes the effect of the selected relic to this custom techID.

    • trShowChoiceDialog

      public void trShowChoiceDialog​(string maintext, string choice1, int event1ID, string choice2, int event2ID)
      Displays dialog with 2 choices, and activates a trigger in response.
      Local Call
      [@local Be careful when used online. The trigger events are only fired locally, so an OoS is likely to occur if 2 players choose different options.]

    • trShowWinLose

      public void trShowWinLose​(string text, string soundfile, float volume)
      Shows a win/lose message and plays a sound.

    • trStartGameRecord

      public void trStartGameRecord()
      Starts recording the game. This functionality seems kind of broken for scenarios. Only the first couple of minutes are recorded.

    • trStopGameRecord

      public void trStopGameRecord()
      Stops recording the game.

      public void trTechGodPower​(int playerID, string techName, int numUses)

      public void trTechGodPowerAtPosition​(int playerID, string techName, int numUses, int slot)
      Adds X uses to the specified god power in a specific GP slot (1-4).

    • trTechInvokeGodPower

      public void trTechInvokeGodPower​(int playerID, string techName, vector pos1, vector pos2)
      Invokes the specified god power. Ensure that the player actually possesses the given power first. Since AoT this precondition is not required anymore for Mother Nature.

    • trTechSetStatus

      public void trTechSetStatus​(int playerID, int techID, int statusID)

    • trShowScoreMessage

      public void trShowScoreMessage​(int player, string soundfile)
      Shows the player's kill/loss ratio as the score in the middle of the screen.

      The message can be removed with gadgetUnreal("winLoseDisplay").

      Since:
      AoM:EE

    • trSetTimeOfDayPeriod

      public void trSetTimeOfDayPeriod​(float period)
      Sets the day-night cycle period in seconds. A value of period that is less than 1.0 switches off day-night cycle.
      Since:
      AoM:EE

    • trSetPlayerCustomScore

      public void trScoreMsgBox​(int player, string text, string subtitle, int eventID)
      Displays the given text along with the player's current score in a centered message box with an OK button.

      The subtitle parameter doesn't seem to do anything.

      Since:
      AoM:EE
